intro: Prunus spinosa proles microstigma, commonly known as the dwarf blackthorn, is a shrub native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its thorny stems and small, dark blue-black berries that ripen in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1–2 meters and thrives in well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and white, appearing in early spring before the leaves. The species is often found in hedgerows and woodland edges, where it plays a role in supporting local wildlife.
